H0.text: Cut, colour, clarity and carat are all considered when purchasing what. Diamond

H1.text: Cut, colour, clarity and carat are all considered when purchasing what. Gemstone

H2.text: Cut, colour, clarity and carat are all considered when purchasing what. Jewelry

H3.text: Cut, colour, clarity and carat are all considered when purchasing what. Bortz

A4.text: Four characteristics, known informally as the four Cs, are now commonly used as the basic descriptors of diamonds: these are its mass in carats (a carat being equal to 0.2 grams), cut (quality of the cut is graded according to proportions, symmetry and polish), color (how close to white or colorless; for fancy diamonds how intense is its hue), and clarity (how free is it from inclusions).

A5.text: The GIA developed 11 clarity scales to decide the quality of a diamond for its sale value.
